newsitem.title: UK: UK Conservatives slowly erode Labour lead.
newsitem.headline: UK Conservatives slowly erode Labour lead.

text.p: Britain's ruling Conservative Party is gradually eroding the opposition Labour Party's opinion poll lead but the process is proving slow, according to a Gallup survey published on Friday.
The poll in the Daily Telegraph gave Labour 58.5 percent support compared with 59 percent in early August.
The Conservatives stood at 25.5 percent against 25 percent and the minority Liberal Democrats were steady at 11 percent.
Labour leader Tony Blair's popularity with the voters has fallen as a result of internal party wrangling. He is given 36.1 percent backing, down from 37.7 percent in July.
Prime Minister John Major's popularity has risen to 19.4 percent from 18.4 percent.
He must call a general election by May 1997. In an interview published on Thursday he dashed Labour hopes of an early election by ruling out going to the polls this year.
